body_html:
derivatives.yaml states:

  • Any of the input arguments, tensor or non-tensor, including argument names that only appear in Declarations.cwrap, e.g. 'output'.

So I find it an issue indeed, I am auto generating a nim version of torch ( releasing this week hopefully ) and having consistent data is a must.

https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/search?q=elu_forward&unscoped_q=elu_forward
returns nothing with input_scale.

Thanks for pointing me out to nn.yaml tho, which I'll go find now.

body:
derivatives.yaml states:
> - Any of the input arguments, tensor or non-tensor, including argument names that only appear in Declarations.cwrap, e.g. 'output'.

So I find it an issue indeed, I am auto generating a *nim* version of torch ( releasing this week hopefully ) and having consistent data is a must.

https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/search?q=elu_forward&unscoped_q=elu_forward 
returns nothing with input_scale.

Thanks for pointing me out to nn.yaml tho, which I'll go find now.
